articles.title: Storm Julia kills 25 in Central America as it churns toward Mexico - Reuters
articles.description: The death toll from storm Julia rose to at least 25 on Monday, officials said, with most victims in El Salvador and Guatemala, as the weakening storm dumped heavy rain on a swath of Central America and southern Mexico.

articles.title: Bernanke, two other Americans win Nobel Prize in economics - The Washington Post
articles.description: Ben Bernanke, the former Fed chair, Douglas W. Diamond of the University of Chicago and Philip H. Dybvig of Washington University in St. Louis were awarded the prize for research on banks and financial crises.

articles.title: Venezuela landslides: Dozens killed as homes swept away - BBC
articles.description: At least 36 people have died and 56 are missing as torrential rain hits the Latin American country.
articles.content:
The number of people killed has risen to 36, and 56 others are missing, after landslides swept away their homes in the Venezuelan town of Las Tejerías.

articles.description: "This at least balances the mayhem that the Americans are causing," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said of the OPEC+ production cuts, per media reports.
